title: Thousands Of Gold Scheme Investors Cheated As Goodwin Jewellery Chain's Owners Flee With Crores
text:
It was a 'black Diwali' for the lakhs of depositors of the scam-hit PMC bank this year. But they are not the only ones who are now staring at an uncertain future of their investments.

Hundreds of customers who had invested in the investment schemes of Goodwin Jewellers were caught off guard just ahead of the festivals after it came to light that the owners, Sunilkumar and Sudheesh Kumar are missing, so is their money.

BCCL

Goodwin Jewellery Group has 12 branches in Thane, Navi Mumbai, Mumbai, and Kerala, which are now shut for days.

Several people had kept their gold with the jewellers and invested in their fixed deposit and investment schemes.

They have now filed multiple cases against the owners alleging fraud.

As the investigations began, the two promoters of Goodwin Sunil Kumar and Sudesh Kumar, both brothers hailing from Kerala, who had been missing for nearly a week released a video, speaking in Malayalam, reassuring the investors that their deposits are safe and their money cannot be returned at the moment as they are facing some financial difficulties and said that they are trying to raise funds to overcome the crisis.

Goodwin jewellery began as a manufacturing unit in Kerala and later entered into wholesale, and then retail business. Even in Maharashtra, most of its customers are people from Kerala living in the state.
